subject: [luci-commotion] Additional Network
message_content:
Another option is to change this from "Additional Network Interfaces" to "Ethernet Interfaces" or "Wired Interfaces", and have sections to assign the functionality of the Ethernet port(s), and whether they are advertised gateways.

This would provide more clarity when there are multiple Ethernet interfaces, or a switch on the device - as is the case with the TP-Link WDR series devices, and the Buffalo devices. Some ports are switched LAN ports that may just have DHCP on by default. Some ports (such as the case of a single-port device or a device with a WAN port) will be Commotion default or DHCP clients only. These should still be possible to configure with static IPs and have meshing via Ethernet as option as well, as @dismantl suggests above.

A suggestion on the layout:

## Ethernet Ports
If desired, you can configure your Ethernet (wired) interfaces here.

### eth0 - WAN
This is the main Ethernet port on the device.

#### Mesh on this Interface
If this device is wired to other Commotion devices directly or through a switch or router, you can enable meshing over Ethernet.
( ) - Enable mesh over Ethernet
(x) - Disable mesh over Ethernet

#### IP configuration:
How will this interface's IP address be configured?
(x) - Commotion default: Try and aquire an IP address with DHCP. If it succeeds, configure as a gateway. If it times out, hand out IP addresses on this port with DHCP.
( ) - Only receive IP addresses on this interface. Will be configured as a DHCP client only.
( ) - Only hand out IP addresses on this interface. It will be configured as a DHCP server only.
( ) - Manually provide a static IP address. (upon selection input fields will appear)

#### Gateway advertisement
By default, Commotion shares connections to the Internet if they are detected. If you wish, you can allow connections to the Internet only from the local access point or Ethernet ports.
(x) - Enable Gateway advertisement from this interface to the mesh.
( ) - Disable Gateway advertisement from this interface.

### eth1 - LAN
These are the switched Ethernet port(s) on the device.

#### Mesh on this Interface
If this device is wired to other Commotion devices directly or through a switch or router, you can enable meshing over Ethernet.
( ) - Enable mesh over Ethernet
(x) - Disable mesh over Ethernet

#### IP configuration:
How will this interface's IP address be configured?
( ) - Commotion default: Try and aquire an IP address with DHCP. If it succeeds, configure as a gateway. If it times out, hand out IP addresses on this port with DHCP.
( ) - Only receive IP addresses on this interface. Will be configured as a DHCP client only.
(x) - Only hand out IP addresses on this interface. It will be configured as a DHCP server only.
( ) - Manually provide a static IP address. (upon selection input fields will appear)

subject: [luci-commotion] Additional Network
message_content:
I think this is what's supposed to happen when there are multiple interfaces, but +1 to Andy's suggestion.

If we can also have some graphics that describe how this works that would be ideal as most users don't read all of the text supporting the explanations of how the different options work.

subject: [luci-commotion] Client Controls > Welcome Page:
message_content:
At the moment users can edit the HTML or upload an HTML file, it'd be great to have the ability to preview what the Welcome Page will look like to users.

The easiest way to do this would be to add a "Preview" button that opens the welcome page in another tab.

subject: [luci-commotion] Add Reboot router to the basic
message_content: Frequently users need to reboot the router, which is currently buried in the advanced menu. It would be great to have this in the Basic Menu. As part of the next iteration on the UI design, we should assess where the best place for this should be in the basic menu, e.g. as a button in the left menu or as an option on the main Status page.

subject: [luci-commotion] Advanced Menu view: Keep the
message_content:
At the moment "Basic" appears below "Logout" in the menu list in the advanced view.

Basic should either appear at the top of the list so that it's easy to jump back, or should appear above the "logout" button at the bottom of the list. It's confusing to users and frequently off screen if it's at the bottom of the list.

subject: [luci-commotion] Add MAC address of the device to
message_content:
Another vital piece of information when troubleshooting is to be able to cross-reference the MAC address for the device. It would be great if the MAC address for the whole device was available on the Status page view in the basic menu.

We will need to investigate which MAC address (lan0, radio0, wan0, eth0, etc) is the right one to include as routers with multiple interfaces have MAC addresses for each interface. Ideally we want the MAC address in the status page to match the address listed on the external packaging of the router.

subject: [commotion-docs] Changes to table on Commotion
message_content:
Some suggestions for readability on the [Downloads](https://commotionwireless.net/download/routers/) page. The table is somewhat hard to read, as the elements are centered and wrap on narrow browser widths.
* Make the "Router" column left-justified (or make the entire table left-justified).
* Create another column for the signature, so these elements are aligned vertically.

subject: [commotion-translation-generator] Update
message_content:
The script seems to give an error when it first clones the repositories that it parses for strings:
`
Creating working directories
mkdir working/
mkdir working/source/
mkdir working/translations/
Cloning commotion-feed into working/source/
Cloning into 'working/source/commotion-feed'... at ./parse.pl line 131.
Couldn't clone https://github.com/opentechinstitute/commotion-feed.git
	Checking out master branch
Cloning olsrd into working/source/
Cloning into 'working/source/olsrd'... at ./parse.pl line 131.
Couldn't clone https://github.com/opentechinstitute/olsrd.git
	Checking out master branch
`
...etc. Despite this, it still seems to generate the .po files.

Additionally, it might be a good idea to add a note in the documentation that you need to update the po files in luci-i18n-commotion with the latest files from transifex before creating the update files, otherwise you risk overwriting existing content in transifex.

subject: [commotion-translation-generator] Have script
message_content: Currently, the script pulls the .po files from luci-i18n-commotion, parses the repositories, and adds new strings to the .po files. Then these new .po files are then uploaded manually to Transifex for translation. However, given that you should always pull the most up-to-date files from Transifex before checking for updated strings (so that when you later upload the files, you aren't overwriting new translations in Transifex), this imposes a few additional unnecessary steps (i.e., you should download files from Transifex, add them to luci-i18n-commotion, run this script, upload to transifex, download the files, and add them to luci-i18n-commotion _again_). It would be much better if this script pulled the current .po files from Transifex directly using their API, rather than pulling the (potentially already old) files from luci-i18n-commotion as a starting point.

subject: [luci-commotion] Optimize CSS for size (#401)
message_content:
After the next round of UI review and changes, the router stylesheets should all be optimized and reformatted for size.

@glamrock suggested [Clean CSS](http://cleancss.com/) as a resource. Even the default settings would save ~6k on cascade.css alone, and strike a decent balance between size and readability. Readability is a design requirement so the most aggressive formatting option is not recommended.

subject: [commotion-translation-generator] Research:
message_content:
The translation generator tries to minimize duplicate entries by checking for duplicate strings, but is easily fooled. Strings must be a 100% match, including punctuation and line breaks, to be caught by the check. LuCI's translate function also requires a 100% match in order to swap the correct translation.

It would be great if the script could check for similar strings or near matches, allowing developers to correct minor formatting issues or reuse existing strings and translations elsewhere in the UI, and minimizing duplication of effort by the translators.

There's a thread on PerlMonks about [fuzzy text matching]](http://www.perlmonks.org/?node_id=816086) that might serve as a good starting point.

subject: [luci-commotion] Bridge configuration not
message_content:
When a node does not receive a DHCP lease from an upstream router, the `eth0` and `wlan0` interfaces are placed in the `br-lan` bridge. However, when you look at the bridge configuration for the `br-lan` interface in the Web UI, it only shows the `wlan0` interface in configuration. This is not only inaccurate, but it makes it impossible to remove the `eth0` interface from the bridge without using the command line, thus preventing the user from manually configuring the ethernet interface.

This bug seems affects multiple mesh-over-ethernet scenarios in the Common Configurations guide.

subject: [luci-commotion] Ethernet interface not added to
message_content: When a node is initially configured with the `eth0` and `wlan0` interfaces in a bridge, and you then change the `eth0` interface from the Commotion protocol to static protocol (for a mesh-over-ethernet scenario), the `eth0` interface is not put back into the `wan` firewall zone. This prevents the interface from, among other things, NATing traffic, and thus creates routing problems.

subject: [luci-commotion] Bridge configuration not
message_content: Fixing this bug will greatly simplify any meshing over Ethernet configurations, I would love to see this prioritized.

subject: [luci-commotion] Bridge configuration not
message_content: On par with this as a priority, I think we should also focus on having a way to enable the various mesh-over-ethernet configurations from the Basic menu.

subject: [luci-commotion] Bridge configuration not
message_content: Yes - as you mentioned in #209 ? I would definitely support anything that makes this more of a simple menu / checkbox process.

subject: [commotion-docs] Issue 195 - Fixing broken
message_content: @andygunn Looks good, with the exception of a broken link to the main PDF for the module in the sidebar, presumably because it's being updated? Was this one of the non-Indesign PDFs that was removed? To remove the "Download PDF" button on the right, we just need to drop this line from a page's front matter: pdf: path/to/file.pdf
